title: (Reintroduced) Judgment can once again critically strike for bonus damage

like im watching a garen with warriors, dead mans plate, cleaver, last whisper, and for some reason bloodthirster. but his spin deals a total of 2700 damage.

> [{quoted}](name=The Loveless,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PnwLMyJt,comment-id=0012,timestamp=2015-08-08T23:55:04.429+0000)

actually ive watched the replay of marinerevenges stream. and his q was still able to crit a couple of days ago before they readded it to the spin. if they havent changed that in the meantime, both spells should crit.

otherwise, dead mans plate can add some neat burst to the q.

I actually don't like the crit re-introduction honestly. They had to nerf E's ratio to do it, and before this, it was sitting at a pretty 440% AD at level 18. Damage potential goes up if you build crit, but honestly Garen's best build is probably just going to be Sunfire/Dead Man's Plate with BC and Titanic Hydra if he wants more damage, so this just feels like a nerf to E for me.

> [{quoted}](name=Knight Kore,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PnwLMyJt,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-08-07T15:39:01.670+0000)

Damage potential goes up if you build crit, but honestly Garen's best build is probably just going to be Sunfire/Dead Man's Plate with BC and Titanic Hydra if he wants more damage, so this just feels like a nerf to E for me.

ghostblade is one of his most versatile items. the synergy with his kit is really strong. they reduced the scaling, not even the base damage by 10%. ghostblades crit alone should increase this damage by 15% on average and bring it back up to the previous value.

but if you also build i.e. on him the damage is gonna be gigantic. his spin already deals vastly more damage than on live. like between 2 and 3 times the value.
This all depends. Garen's E does not crit for double damage. It crits for 50% boosted damage, meaning its crit multiplier is not 200%, it's 150%, so 15% crit is closer to 7.5% average DPS.

> [{quoted}](name=Zair Umbras,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PnwLMyJt,comment-id=000400010000,timestamp=2015-08-07T18:33:43.836+0000)

its a 10% damage nerf on the scaling.

and critical strikes cause the scaling part of the spin to crit for 200% damage. meaning 15% crit increase the damage of the scaling part on average by 15%.

the base damage of the spin wasnt touched.

> [{quoted}](name=Jelly Mac,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PnwLMyJt,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2015-08-07T18:35:25.199+0000)
>

i put a link into one of my posts here. its in the op of the garen thread on the pbe boards. you have to scroll down to todays update.

No, Garen's E does not crit for 100% boosted damage. It does not have a 200% crit multiplier. As of this moment on Live, it has a 150% crit multipier. If you crit with his E, it does 50% more damage and even STATES this. Garen on the PBE does not specify if it's for normal crit multiplier or if it's the same 50%, it simply says that it can crit for bonus damage. I'd guess they're keeping it at 150%, not putting it up at 200%.

For some one who's named 'Critmaster Garen', you sure don't know much about how his E crits. 0.o

> [{quoted}](name=Zair Umbras,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PnwLMyJt,comment-id=00040001000000000000,timestamp=2015-08-08T01:20:41.389+0000)

ah, crap i messed up. yes, you need an i.e. for the 100% damage boost.

its the ad scaling portion of the ability that can critically strike. however, according to the rioter working on him, the ad ratio is much higher than the live values. (also from the looks of the pbe games).

this means the stat does become better on him with the rework, if the formula stays the same. maybe theyre gonna use an entirely different formula, dont know.

even if just the ad ratio crits, a crit with an i.e. almost gives the spin an extra damage tick in value as the base damage is much lower than what your ad contributes.

> [{quoted}](name=TotalJerk,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PnwLMyJt,comment-id=0010,timestamp=2015-08-08T07:52:54.089+0000)
>
> I'm still not going to buy crit on Garen. No room in a build for it.

depends on what you want to build for. infinity edge is still one of his strongest items for raw damage.

i almost cant live without ghostblade anymore, since it allows me to work around a lot of his weak points. extra mobility on the active, and the problem that he cant do much when his spin is on cooldown. 

in extrended fights, after i burned my spin i usually like to pop the ghostblade active to keep going with powerful auto attacks, until the spin is back up.

garen actually will have a lot of build diversity with the new update. there are a ton of items and build pathes to chose from. more than before.

> [{quoted}](name=Knight Kore,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PnwLMyJt,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-08-07T15:39:01.670+0000)

Damage potential goes up if you build crit, but honestly Garen's best build is probably just going to be Sunfire/Dead Man's Plate with BC and Titanic Hydra if he wants more damage, so this just feels like a nerf to E for me.

They didn't nerf E's ratio to do it - they nerfed E's ratio because he was too strong late. The guy in charge of the rework said they aren't expecting crit to actually be a strong build on him, so they reintroduced it because some Garen players find it fun and it'll have very little impact on his strength.

There was no power removed from his kit in order to give him back crit, he would have had the AD ratio nerf regardless.
